result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeron Ross Davis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Must complete domestic abuse programming per DOC

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Victim 1. The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis. Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases21CF9, 22CF29, and 22CF168. State recites agreement. 22CF9 - 2years IC, 2 years ES imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 33 days jail with 33 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. 22CF29 - plead to disorderly conduct with domestic abuse modifier. 14 days jail with 14 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. 22CF168 - plead to counts 1, 2, 3, and 6. 2 and 3 - 2 years IC, 2 years ES, imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 69 days jail with 69 days credit, time served. Count 6, 69 days jail, time served. Count 1, 60 days jail, time served.

22CF29, defendant pleads no contest to count 1. 22CF168, defendant pleads no contest to count 1, count 2, count 3, and count 6. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court reviews voting rights. JOC is entered in count 1 of 21CF9 due to agreement of parties and the deferred agreement is revoked. Court accepts pleas and finds that the pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Any other remaining counts are dismissed. 

Court orders in 22CF29 - on count 1, 14 days jail with 14 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. Bail to cover amount and to cover any balance on other cases. In 21CF9, 2years IC, 2 years ES imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 33 days jail with 33 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs, and DOC programming. Bail to cover amount and to cover any balance on other cases. In 22CF168, Count 1 - 60 days jail, with 60 days credit, time served. Count 6, 69 days jail with 69 days credit. Time served. Count 2 and 3, 2 years IC, 2 years ES. Imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. If revoked, prison time will be consecutive to 21CF9, but count 2 and 3 will be concurrent to each other. Probation is concurrent to each other and other files. Conditions of 69 days jail, 69 days credit. Time served. DOC programming, DAIP programming, $50 fine plus costs. No contact with victim but the no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. Prohibited from possessing firearms. 21CF9 - ineligible for both programs. 22CF168 - eligible for both programs.

11:30 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates close to agreement, asks for plea date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF168, received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman requests a status conference next week. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:07 PM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Hoffman argues for reduction of bond, indigent, lifelong resident of Superior. Could possible $2000.
State believe bails is appropriate, has 2 other pending matters which were sent for a plea before he was arrested on current charges. Cites priors. Has prior FTA's in Minnesota. And a 2016 FTA in Wisconsin. Believes $5000 is appropriate. 
Hoffman has no additional argument.
Court notes 5 FTA's and numerous bail jumps. Didn't appear in the lower amounts previously set.
Court denies motion. Bond and conditions to continue. 
Defendant argues for a lower amount. Advised to consult with attorney.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim 1 or their residence. Third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. No use or possession of alcohol.

1:54 PM 
Atty Craker verifies Dfd's address. Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chad La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Craker waive rdg, ask prelim hearing, NG plea
Atty La Lor request $10,000 cb , no contact w/victim in key except 3rd party for child, no use of alcohol. Dfd's 3rd open case against same victim, lead police on foot chase. 21CF9 strangulation case with same victim, 22CF29 D/C pending has no contact w/victim or her residence. FTA on $500 cash and signature bond. 22CF29 $1000 cash was ordered, these were set to go to plea/snt tomorrow but offer is now revoked. 2016 crim damage to property w/FTA, 2014 hit and run MN w/FTA. 2009 theft w/FTA. Had FTA in every case he had, refuses to follow no contact with victim condition and additional crimes against victim.
Atty Craker does not believe that amount of cash is justified. Mr. Hoffman represents on pending cases and he has made all his court appearances on pending case, he is Superior resident and his children are here in town, ties to community. His MN record FTA's are quite dated. Not sure how much he can post at this time. 
Court states 5 FTA's and allegations expose him to more than 30 years in prison and he can't follow court orders. Also nature of charges verbally combative to jail staff, police.
Court orders $5000.00 cb conditions of no contact w/victim 1 or their residence except 3rd party contact for child purposes only. Also no use/possession of alcohol.
Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
